content.description:
Veiled Citizen climbs a slightly overhung, blunt arete on perfect edges.

Sit start with a pair of round jugs. From there, tic tac up to a sidepull and edge, then make a big move out right to a pinch/sidepull, reel in the feet (crux?), bump the left hand from the sidepull to a horizontal edge, achieve a high left (crux?) foot on the start holds, reach and match hands on the crimp rail, then set and dyno to the lip, and top it out.

I feel like the problem could possibly be climbed without the right hand pinch, but I liked the movement, and the solution seemed like a good one.
content.protection: A few pads is enough, the landing is really good.
content.location: It ascends the blunt arete on the west face of Veiled Citizen.

content.description: Stand start on the slab with a left hand pinch and a right hand pinch.  From there, work the feet, hit the arete with the left hand, bump the right hand up to a smaller sidepull, then work the feet up high (crux), and move to the lip and top it out.
content.protection: A few pads, as the problem has a tree stump directly behind it, and falling off to the right and left may be hazardous.
content.location: This is on the North face of Veiled Citizen Boulder.

content.description: Sit start with both hands using the crack as a side and move out right the lip. The tricky move will be staying balance to get your left hand to the lip. From there, do some fun moves up to the top out.
content.protection: Pads and spotter.  It is not a great spot for a fall.
content.location: This is on the backside of the boulder. Go down the same side or do an easy downclimb on other side of the boulder.

content.description:
Chocolate Couture is a straightforward crimp test.  Stand start by reaching a right hand, incut sidepull and a left hand on an oblique crimp.  From there, move straight up the slightly overhung face using a bulbous knob and crimp rail.  The topout is solid and juggy.  Downclimb the opposite face.

Shorter folks may need to stack a few pads to reach the start holds.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter, landing is great though.
content.location: This is on the West-face of the Veiled Citizen Boulder.

content.description:
Start on the same holds as

Puddin' Taine

, but rather than moving right, proceed straight up the crack to top out.
content.protection: Crash pad, maybe a spotter - the landing is a little sketchy.
